main_definition: Everything refers to all things, objects, or concepts without exception.

meanings_and_examples.definition: All that exists or is possible in the world
meanings_and_examples.example: After his accident, he felt like nothing mattered anymore; everything seemed pointless.
She looked at everything on her desk and decided what to keep or throw away.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The entirety of a particular subject matter or topic
meanings_and_examples.example: In his book, the author covers everything about World War II from its causes to aftermath.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A non-specific reference to all items in question
meanings_and_examples.example: When asked how many apples he ate last week, he said 'I didn't eat anything; I threw everything away.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression of indifference or lack of interest towards any specific item
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Everything' is my response whenever someone asks me if there's a particular book or movie I dislike.
